page.title: 13FARMING, DOWNS EDINGTON (5)
page.content: About a hundred single suckler Hereford Cross Friesian cows are bought in and run with the Charollais or Blond d'Aquitaine bulls to calve in spring.Most of the calves are sold as stores the following May.The rest are grazed until autumn,then finished indoors and sold fat at eighteen months to two years old.The flock of six hundred Scottish half bred ewes are put to the Suffolk rams in mid October.They are over-wintered on the downs and brought onto lowland leys in summer and autumn.It is hoped to in-winter them in 1985/86.The farmer has been told that as more use is to be made by the MOD of Schedule 3 land from 1985 all of it has to be put down to grass.
